intro: Seddera hadramautica, commonly known as the Hadramaut seddera, is a rare flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant is adapted to arid environments, featuring succulent leaves that help store water. It grows in rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas, where it thrives in the unique microclimate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
